alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Johnston; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 13 at 8:23AM CST until December 13 at 8:45AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSTON...NORTHWESTERN BRYAN...NORTHEASTERN MARSHALL AND SOUTHWESTERN ATOKA COUNTIES... At 823 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northeast of Woodville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Durant, Silo, Kenefic, Mead, Armstrong, Woodville, Little City, Nida, northeastern Lake Texoma, Calera and Mcbride. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
